monster.name: Agdon Longscarf
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If Agdon is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Agdon's long jump is up to 20 feet and his high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Agdon makes two Branding Iron or Dagger attacks.

action.name: Branding Iron
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target is magically branded. Agdon is invisible to creatures branded in this way. The brand disappears after 24 hours, or it can be removed from a creature or object by any spell that ends a curse.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Agdon halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. He must be able to see the attacker.

monster.name: Alagarthas
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Alagarthas has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Alagarthas has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Alagarthas makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, Alagarthas can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand him. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Alagarthas is incapacitated.

monster.name: Amidor the Dandelion
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
trait.text: Amidor can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if it shared a language with them.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Seed Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Amidor adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, Amidor must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Bavlorna Blightstraw
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Bavlorna casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monster.spells: Detect Magic,Plane Shift,Create Food and Water,Polymorph,Remove Curse

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Bavlorna can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Bavlorna is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Widdershins Allergy
trait.text: If a creature within 10 feet of Bavlorna uses at least 10 feet of movement to run in place counterclockwise, Bavlorna is overcome by a fit of sneezing and can't cast spells until the end of her next turn. In addition, any creature Bavlorna has swallowed is immediately expelled and falls prone in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of her.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Bavlorna makes one Bite attack and one Withering Ray attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Bavlorna can't use her Bite attack on another target.

action.name: Withering Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Create Lornlings (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Bavlorna creates one or two 1-foot-tall duplicates of herself, called lornlings (use the Quickling stat block in appendix C). Each lornling appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Bavlorna, obeys her commands, and takes its turn immediately after hers. A lornling lasts for 1 hour, until it or Bavlorna dies, or until Bavlorna dismisses it as an action. Bavlorna can have no more than eight lornlings in existence at a time.

monster.name: Brigganock
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The brigganock casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11):

monster.spells: Minor Illusion,Spare the Dying,Animal Friendship,Faerie Fire,Meld into Stone,Silence

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The brigganock has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Soul Light
trait.text: The brigganock is accompanied by an insubstantial, invulnerable ball of light that contains its soul. The brigganock can't turn off the light or control its brightness. The soul light sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If the brigganock dies, its soul light fades away.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: Using a pickaxe or similar tool, a brigganock can burrow through solid rock at a speed of 5 feet, leaving a 6-inch-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Pickaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Time Lapse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The brigganock accelerates the passage of time around itself, enabling it to accomplish up to 1 hour of work in a matter of seconds. This work can't affect any creature other than the brigganock, or any object being worn or carried by another creature, and the activity must take place within a 10-foot cube. For example, the brigganock could use this action to rapidly carve a pumpkin, cook and eat dinner, move a pile of stones, or tie a dozen knots in a length of rope.

monster.name: Bullywug Knight
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The knight can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
trait.text: The knight can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The knight's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The knight makes two Glaive attacks.

action.name: Glaive
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.name: Campestri
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
monster.languages: understands Common but speaks only through the use of its Mimicry trait

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The campestri can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

action.name: Head Butt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
action.text: A 5-foot radius of spores extends from the campestri. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Clapperclaw the Scarecrow
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: Clapperclaw doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Stuffing
action.text: Clapperclaw stuffs straw or other dead plant matter into itself and regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Roll a d6; on a 1 or 2, Clapperclaw runs out of stuffing and must spend 8 hours foraging for more before it can use this action again.

monster.name: Displacer Beast Kitten
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Displacement
trait.text: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 bludgeoning damage plus 2 piercing damage.

monster.name: Elkhorn
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Elkhorn wields a +1 longsword.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Elkhorn makes two Dagger or +1 Longsword attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature that is Large or bigger, it takes an extra 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage when used with two hands. If the target is a creature that is Large or bigger, it takes an extra 5 (1d10) slashing damage.

monster.name: Endelyn Moongrave
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Endelyn casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Endelyn is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Eclipsed Doom
trait.text: Endelyn can be killed only if she is reduced to 0 hit points during a solar eclipse or while she is within 60 feet of a symbolic representation of one. Otherwise, Endelyn disappears in a cloud of inky smoke when she drops to 0 hit points, along with anything she was wearing or carrying, and reappears 24 hours later in the same location or the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Uncanny Awareness
trait.text: Endelyn can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Endelyn makes two Puppeteer's Lash attacks

action.name: Puppeteer's Lash
action.text: ms,rs +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, Endelyn telekinetically moves it up to 10 feet in any direction horizontally.

monster.name: Envy
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If Envy moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, Envy can make one attack with its claws against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Envy exhales petrifying gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

monster.name: Flying Rocking Horse
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
monster.speed: [object Object] ft., fly 40 ft. (only while mounted; hover)

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the rocking horse is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the rocking horse move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the rocking horse is animate.

trait.name: Flying Mount
trait.text: The rocking horse can serve as a mount for a Medium or smaller creature and can fly only while mounted.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The rocking horse doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it regains no hit points or Hit Dice at the end of a long rest.

action.name: Head Butt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Giant Dragonfly
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Drone
trait.text: When it beats its wings, the dragonfly emits a loud droning sound that can be heard out to a range of 120 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The dragonfly halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker.

monster.name: Giant Snail
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Salt Osmosis
trait.text: Whenever the snail starts its turn in contact with a pound or more of salt, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage. Using an action to sprinkle a pound of salt on the snail deals 1d4 necrotic damage to it immediately and another 1d4 necrotic damage to it at the start of its next turn (after which the salt rubs off), provided the snail has not withdrawn into its shell.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The snail withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to its AC until it emerges. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

monster.name: Giant Swan
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The swan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The swan makes two attacks with its beak.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Glass Pegasus
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
monster.languages: Celestial,Common,Elvish and Sylvan but can't speak

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Glasswork Golem
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the golem is embedded in a window and motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the golem move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the golem is animate.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the golem takes bludgeoning or thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the golem's next turn. The golem is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two Glass Sword attacks.

action.name: Glass Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.name: Gloam
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

action.name: Cloud of Dust
action.text: On its first turn in combat or when it is reduced to 0 hit points, the cat expels a cloud of dust that acts as dust of sneezing and choking

monster.name: Harengon Brigand
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The harengon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the harengon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The harengon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Harengon Sniper
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The harengon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (the target gains no benefit from less than total cover), range 320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. Hit or Miss: Immediately after making this attack, the harengon can use the Hide action.

monster.name: Iggwilv the Witch Queen
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Iggwilv casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 24, +16 to hit with spell attacks):

monster.spells: Detect Magic,Disguise Self,Invisibility,Light,Mage Hand,Message,Prestidigitation,Tasha's Hideous Laughter,Dispel Magic,Fly,Polymorph,Maze,Telekinesis,Teleport,Wish

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Iggwilv is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Iggwilv fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Iggwilv has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. (This trait is bestowed by her robe of the archmagi.)

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Iggwilv wears an amulet of the planes and a robe of the archmagi.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Iggwilv makes two Bewitching Bolt attacks.

action.name: Bewitching Bolt
action.text: ms,rs +16 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (5d6 + 8) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 22 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by Iggwilv until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Abyssal Rift (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Iggwilv opens a momentary Abyssal rift within 120 feet of her. The rift is a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 40 (9d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, there is a 50 percent chance that 3 hezrous then appear in unoccupied spaces in the sphere. They act as Iggwilv's allies, take their turns immediately after hers, and can't summon other demons. They remain until they die or until Iggwilv dismisses them as an action.

reaction.name: Negate Spell (2/Day)
reaction.text: When Iggwilv sees a creature within 60 feet of her casting a spell, she tries to interrupt it. If the creature is casting a spell using a spell slot of 8th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a 9th-level spell, it must succeed on a 22 Intelligence saving throw, or the spells fails and has no effect.

legendary.name: Witchcraft
legendary.text: Iggwilv uses Spellcasting or Fey Step.

legendary.name: Dark Speech (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Iggwilv utters a phrase in a forbidden language and targets one or two creatures she can see within 60 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a 22 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage and be frightened of Iggwilv for 1 minute. A target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success and thereby becoming immune to Iggwilv's Dark Speech for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Fey Beguilement (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Iggwilv targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a 22 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by a fey spirit. While possessed, the target must obey Iggwilv's commands. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the fey spirit and ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Jabberwock
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Confusing Burble
trait.text: The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:
[object Object]

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The jabberwock regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the jabberwock takes slashing damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jabberwock dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Uncanny Tracker
trait.text: The jabberwock can unerringly track any creature it has wounded in the last 24 hours, and it knows the distance and direction to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The jabberwock makes two Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fiery Gaze (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Unless it is blinded, the jabberwock emits a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line of fire from its eyes. Each creature in that line must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The jabberwock makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Rend Attack (2 Actions)
legendary.text: The jabberwock makes one Rend attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (3 Actions)
legendary.text: The jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

monster.name: Jingle Jangle
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: Jingle Jangle can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

action.name: Flail of Locks
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (3d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Kelek
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Kelek casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Kelek wears bracers of defense and carries a staff of striking with 10 charges. The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a d20; on a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Kelek makes three attacks using Sorcerer's Bolt, Staff of Striking, or a combination of them. He can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Sorcerer's Bolt
action.text: ms,rs +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d12) force damage.

action.name: Staff of Striking
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, or 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Kelek can expend up to 3 of the staff's charges, dealing an extra 3 (1d6) force damage for each expended charge.

action.name: Fiery Explosion (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Kelek creates a magical explosion of fire centered on a point he can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
reaction.text: When he is hit by an attack, Kelek protects himself with an invisible barrier of magical force. Until the end of his next turn, he gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

monster.name: Kettlesteam the Kenku
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
monster.languages: understands Auran and Common but speaks only through the use of her Mimicry trait

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Kettlesteam casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monster.spells: Disguise Self,Friends,Mage Hand,Minor Illusion,Bestow Curse,Faerie Fire,Speak with Animals

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: Kettlesteam can mimic any sounds she has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful 13 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Kettlesteam makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Twilight Sleep (2/Day)
action.text: Kettlesteam targets one creature she can see within 10 feet of her. The target is engulfed in a cloud of magical, sleep-inducing gas and must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute. A creature put to sleep by this gas awakens instantly if it takes damage, or if someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

monster.name: Living Doll
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the doll is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the doll move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the doll is animate.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The doll regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the doll takes fire or psychic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doll's next turn. The doll is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The doll doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Grabby Hands
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape 6) and takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until this grapple ends. The doll can grapple only one creature at a time.

monster.name: Mercion
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Mercion casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monster.spells: Light,Spare the Dying,Death Ward,Command,Create Food and Water,Cure Wounds,Faerie Fire,Hold Person,Revivify

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Mercion wields a +1 quarterstaff.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Mercion makes one Divine Radiance attack and one +1 Quarterstaff attack. She can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Divine Radiance
action.text: ms,rs +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

action.name: +1 Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Radiant Fire (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Mercion creates a magical explosion of fiery radiance centered on a point she can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Mister Light
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: While carrying the Witchlight vane, Light casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Light has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Light carries and is attuned to the Witchlight vane. In Light's hands, the vane is a finesse weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Light makes two Witchlight vane attacks.

action.name: Witchlight Vane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

monster.name: Mister Witch
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: While carrying the Witchlight watch, Witch casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Witch has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Witch carries and is attuned to the Witchlight watch.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Witch makes two Cane attacks.

action.name: Cane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 6 (1d12) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Molliver
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: When subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Molliver takes no damage on a successful save or half damage on a failed one, provided Molliver is not incapacitated.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Molliver wears +1 leather armor and boots of levitation.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Molliver makes two Dagger or Shortsword attacks, or one of each.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. The attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage if Molliver has advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of Molliver's allies.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. The attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage if Molliver has advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of Molliver's allies.

action.name: Levitate
action.text: While wearing boots of levitation, Molliver casts levitate (self only).

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Molliver halves the damage they take from an attack made against them, provided they can see the attacker.

monster.name: Paper Bird
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The paper bird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Sharp Edges
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

monster.name: Pollenella the Honeybee
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

action.name: Sting
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 piercing damage.

monster.name: Raezil
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of her turns, Raezil can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Raezil has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Raezil deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of hers that isn't incapacitated and Raezil doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Raezil makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Ringlerun
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Ringlerun casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Ringlerun wields a staff of power. It has 20 charges when fully charged and regains 2d8 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff retains its +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls but loses its other properties; on a 20, it regains 1d8 + 2 charges.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ringlerun makes three Staff of Power or Freezing Ray attacks. He can replace one of those attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Staff of Power
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Ringlerun can expend 1 of the staff's charges to deal an extra 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Freezing Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 27 (6d8) cold damage.

action.name: Staff Spell
action.text: While holding his staff of power, Ringlerun can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (spell save 14, +8 to hit with spell attacks): cone of cold (8d8 cold damage; 5 charges), fireball (10d6 fire damage; 5 charges), globe of invulnerability (6 charges), hold monster (5 charges), levitate (2 charges), lightning bolt (10d6 lightning damage; 5 charges), magic missile (1 charge), ray of enfeeblement (1 charge), or wall of force (5 charges).

monster.name: Selenelion Twin
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The Selenelion twins, Gleam and Glister, have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: A Selenelion twin regains 5 hit points at the start of her turn as long as both twins are alive and within 60 feet of each other. A twin dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Twin Bond
trait.text: While both Selenelion twins are alive and on the same plane of existence, each is aware of the other's emotions.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Moon Ray (Gleam Only; 3/Day)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a bat for 1 minute, as though affected by a polymorph spell. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Sun Ray (Glister Only; 3/Day)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Twin Sight (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: In her mind's eye, a Selenelion twin can see what the other twin sees for up to 1 minute, provided both twins are alive and on the same plane of existence. Maintaining this effect requires concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

monster.name: Sir Talavar
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Sir Talavar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components. As the dragon ages and changes color, it gains additional spells as shown below.
1: color spray (Orange), mirror image (Yellow), suggestion (Green), major image (Blue), hallucinatory terrain (Indigo), polymorph (Violet)
1/Day: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion

monster.spells: Color Spray,Mirror Image,Suggestion,Major Image,Hallucinatory Terrain,Polymorph,Dancing Lights,Mage Hand,Minor Illusion

trait.name: Superior Invisibility
trait.text: As a bonus action, Sir Talavar can magically turn invisible until his concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Sir Talavar wears or carries is invisible with him.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
trait.text: Using telepathy, Sir Talavar can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of him.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Sir Talavar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: +1 Tiny Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Sir Talavar exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:
The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.
The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Skabatha Nightshade
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Skabatha casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monster.spells: Detect Magic,Druidcraft,Speak with Animals,Awaken,Plane Shift,Polymorph,Remove Curse,Speak with Plants

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Skabatha is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Forgetfulness
trait.text: The first creature that Skabatha sees after she finishes a long rest is invisible to her. She can't remember seeing the creature or perceive it using her truesight until the end of her next long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Skabatha makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) poison damage.

monster.name: Skylla
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Skylla casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monster.spells: Detect Magic,Disguise Self,Faerie Fire,Fly,Hypnotic Pattern,Invisibility,Mage Armor

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Skylla carries an eldritch staff (see appendix A) with 10 charges. The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a d20; on a 1, the staff is destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Skylla makes two Eldritch Staff attacks. She can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Eldritch Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Skylla can expend up to 3 of the staff's charges, dealing an extra 4 (1d8) lightning damage for each expended charge.

reaction.name: Eldritch Escape
reaction.text: When Skylla takes damage, she can expend 3 charges of her eldritch staff to turn invisible and teleport, along with any equipment she's wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space she can see. She remains invisible until the start of her next turn or until she attacks or casts a spell.

monster.name: Squirt the Oilcan
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If Squirt is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed Squirt move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that Squirt is animate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: Squirt doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boggle Oil (3 Applications)
action.text: Squirt expends 1 application of boggle oil to create a 10-foot-square puddle of slippery, non-flammable oil on the ground within 5 feet of it. The puddle is difficult terrain and lasts for 1 hour. Each creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. Boggles are unaffected by the oil. After it expends all 3 applications, Squirt can't use this action again until its supply of boggle oil is replenished.

monster.name: Strongheart
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Strongheart casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monster.spells: Command,Detect Evil and Good,Protection from Evil and Good,Lesser Restoration,Remove Curse,Zone of Truth

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Strongheart wields Steel, a sentient, lawful good longsword (see appendix A).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Strongheart makes three Steel attacks.

action.name: Steel
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage when used with two hands. Once on each of his turns, Strongheart can also cause the blade to gleam with holy light. If he does so, the target is blinded until the start of Strongheart's next turn.

action.name: Revivify (Recharges at the Next Dawn)
action.text: While holding Steel, Strongheart casts revivify.

reaction.name: Protect Another
reaction.text: When a creature Strongheart can see attacks another creature that is within 5 feet of him, Strongheart can use his reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, provided he is carrying a shield.

monster.name: Swarm of Campestris
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
monster.languages: understands Common but speaks only through the use of its Mimicry trait

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: Each campestri in the swarm can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough to accommodate an individual campestri. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Head Butts
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (4d4) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
action.text: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the swarm. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Tin Soldier
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
trait.text: The tin soldier is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the tin soldier must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the tin soldier remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tin soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Treant Sapling
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the treant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the treant move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the treant is animate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The treant makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
action.text: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as an awakened tree (see the Monster Manual), except they can't speak. An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies, until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree, or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

monster.name: Warduke
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Warduke wears a dread helm (see appendix A) and wields a flame tongue longsword.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Warduke makes three Flame Tongue or Dagger attacks.

action.name: Flame Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage when used with two hands, plus 7 (2d6) fire damage if the weapon is aflame.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Witchlight Hand (Medium)
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The hand casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

trait.name: Secret Expertise
trait.text: The hand has one of these additional skills: Acrobatics +6, Animal Handling +5, Arcana +5, Athletics +4, Medicine +5, or Performance +5.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Pixie Dust (1/Day)
action.text: The hand sprinkles a pinch of pixie dust on itself or another creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The recipient gains a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. If the creature is airborne when this effect ends, it falls safely to the ground, taking no damage and landing on its feet.

monster.name: Zarak
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Zarak carries a potion of invisibility.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zarak makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, plus an extra 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the target is a creature and Zarak has at least 18 hit points.

action.name: Garrote
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Humanoid. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 11). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns, and Zarak can't grapple another creature or use Assassin's Whim.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Zarak halves the damage he takes from an attack made against him, provided he can see the attacker.

monster.name: Zargash
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Zargash casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

trait.name: Cling to Life (Recharges after a Long Rest)
trait.text: The first time Zargash would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, he instead drops to 1 hit point.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Zargash wears a bat-shaped amulet that has the properties of a ring of feather falling.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Deathly Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.
